stories.author: María López
stories.story: I first met the missionaries when they visited my grandmother. I was only sitting in the kitchen doing homework, but something about their message felt familiar. After a few weeks of lessons, I prayed for the first time in years and felt overwhelming peace. I was baptized three months later, and my family followed soon after.

stories.author: James Carter
stories.story: Two missionaries knocked on my door during a difficult period of my life. I had recently lost my job, and I felt directionless. Their kindness stood out, and I agreed to hear more. What started as curiosity became conviction when I read the Book of Mormon. It changed the way I saw my future.

stories.author: Ana Ribeiro
stories.story: I met the missionaries in the plaza where they were playing hymns on a small guitar. The music drew me in. They invited me to church, and the warmth of the members made me feel at home instantly. The missionaries taught me with such patience that I felt like I had known them my whole life.

stories.author: David Kim
stories.story: I grew up without religion, but when I moved for college, two missionaries approached me near campus. I normally avoided conversations about faith, but something pushed me to listen. The message about eternal families resonated deeply with me. I was baptized that same year and later served a mission myself.

stories.author: Lucía Fernández
stories.story: During the pandemic, I felt isolated and scared. I met the missionaries online through a friend who invited me to a virtual scripture study. Their message brought me hope during a dark time. After months of lessons and prayer, I chose to be baptized in a small outdoor service with my closest friends.
